There was no cure at the time. One drug company was close but I arranged a hostile takeover and sold off all the assets. Made a cool hundred mil. Naturally I froze myself until a cure was found. Now here I am, ready to sleaze my way back to the top, 80's style!
As a caveman frozen in a glacier, I face different challenges. The hardest thing was seeing my wife on display in the British Museum.
Hey, buddy, I'm from the same time as you. Remember that song, Safety Dance?
Sure do! We can dance!
Y'know, that dance wasn't as safe as they said it was.
I tell you  Two go-go 80's Reagan-auts like us, we could rule this world!
No question!
If only someone would give us a shot.
They're scared of our raw power. Oh, but if you want a job, I could beg everyone at the company where I work.
Awesome. Awesome to the max!
And finally, the post office meter is for business mail only.
Aw, come on! I've got a lot of ransom notes to send!
Enough talk. It's time for action. I move that everyone come to my apartment to snuggle my cat.
Second.
I move that your cat stinks and is ugly.
Second.
I move that we vote on a new chief executive officer and oust this old creep. And also that make cat smells good and is pretty.
Second.
Very well. I nominate the Professor.
Second.
Second.
Second.
I'm your man.
I vote my 10,000 shares for the Professor.
Yeah, the Professor!
Me!
I nominate That Guy. Not just because he has a suit but because he knows about business and stuff and he has a tie. My shares still count if they went through the washing machine, right?
Well, if I know anything about which number is bigger than the other number, I'd say that--
Now hold on there. Scruffy votes his 40,000 shares for the mysterious stranger.
40,000? How come you have four-times as much stock as the rest of us?
Scruffy believes in this company.
Then we have a tie. And in the event of a tie, the Professor, as the current CEO remains--
I demand the floor. I may only have one share but I get to vote same as anyone. And I'm voting against the cat-hater. Isn't that right, kitty? Hey! You ate my change!
Then it's settled. The new chief executive officer of Planet Express corporation is That Guy.
Please welcome our new chief executive officer, That Guy.
Let's cut to the chase. There are two kinds of people  Sheep and sharks. Anyone who's a sheep is fired. Who's a sheep?
Uh, excuse me? Which is the one people like to hug?

Gutsy question. You're a shark. Sharks are winners and they don't look back 'cause they don't have necks. Necks are for sheep. I am proud to be the shepherd of this herd of sharks and I am gonna lead you to the top in this industry of ... of--
Package delivery.
Package delivery? Oh, God! Fantastic! Now, the first order of business is to blame everything on the guy before me. Professor?
I'll ruin you like I ruined this company.
Terrific. Question number one  What was your overall business plan?
Um, business plan, uh, yes. I keep it here, right next to my heart.
This isn't a business plan, it's an escape plan.
So long, suckers!
Fry, as a fellow 80's dollar-jockey, I'm making you my new vice chairman.
I'm rollin' up the corporate ramp.
It's the end of the line!
We're ruined!
What fevered dream is this that bids to tear this company in twain?
Thank you, come again!
That's what I call a hostile makeover! Hair gel?
No, thanks. I make my own.
This company's gonna shoot straight to the top and stay there, like Cindy Lauper! I ask you  Who is the number one delivery service on Earth?
Is it Planet Express, master?
Is this guy a shark, or what? Seriously though, we stink out loud. Here's the big enchirito. Mom's Friendly Delivery Company.
We can't compete with Mom! Her company is big and evil. Ours is small and neutral.
Switzerland is small and neutral. We're more like Germany; ambitious and misunderstood.
Look, everyone wants to be like Germany but do we really have the pure strength of will?
I say we do! Now are we gonna let ourselves get beaten by an old lady?
Yes, my liege!
No, we're not. And as vice chairman, I believe I speak for the entire board when I issue this challenge to Mom. Look at my butt!
You call that a pressed ham? Walt, hit the retaliate button.
Uh ... um ... hmm ... let's see.
Any button! They all retaliate!
Woo! Yeah! Hit him, hit him, hit him! Now this is the high life; watching apes mangle each other near celebrities.
In my day we went to coke parties but the principle's the same.
Get your stinkin' trike off me, you damn dirty ape.
Listen, big guy, now that you're my protégé, it's time I cut you in on the secret to success. Any guesses?
Uh, work really, really hard?
No.
Oh, thank God!
It's all about appearances. That's why it's time to update our company's stodgy image and give it the sleek, dazzling veneer of the 1980's!
This company's on the fast track to the "It" list. Blast back kudos all around!
Uh, hello? We haven't made one delivery since you two took over.
Delivery has nothing to do with the delivery business. Image, people, image! Scope out this new ad!
We are all one, with one mind, one purpose and one act. Our enemies shall be eaten by squirrels. We shall bow down and worship to ourselves. We shall prevail!
Hey! We were watching that!
That was terrible! People won't even know what we do.
I don't even know what we do. Nah, just kidding! What are, like, a bus or something?
Did you approve that awful ad, Fry?
Yes I did, Leels. And I'll tell you why. Because it grows the brand.
Oh, Lord!
This company's circling the drain, I tell you. I'd sell my stock right now for a sandwich!
Sold!
A complete sangwich? You got fleeced! I would have settled for a hard roll with ketchup inside!
What is this moose drip? The new delivery kings? I'm sick of hearing about those turtle squirts!
But they're kings, Mommy!
Jam a bastard in it, you crap!
Enjoy our private dining room, folks. This is where we serve our richest, most successful chumps!
Tonight, that's us!
What have you got that's really overpriced?
Everything.
Bring me that.
Make it two. And a glass of all your water.
OK, let's work on your execu-speak. I'm worried about "blank".
Don't you worry about "blank". Let me worry about "blank".
Good. I also would have accepted, "Blank? Blank? You're not looking at the big picture!"
What a pleasant surprise!
Shut up, booger blaster! It's time the three of us had a talk.
I'll handle this, Fry. You get back to the farm, shift some paradigms, revolutionise outside the box.
I'm on it. But if you need me, you know where I'll be.
Call me a "booger blaster"! I'll blast a booger so hard that--
Fry, we're worried about Planet Express.
Don't you worry about Planet Express. Let me worry about "blank".
That Guy is nothing but a flashy con man! And you've been hypnotised by his swinging baloney!
You've changed, Fry.
What? I haven't changed. Suz? Have I changed?
No, sir, Mr. Fry.
Thanks, doll.
I don't care what Ms. Johnson says. That Guy's turning this place into some kind of business.
This isn't a business. I've always thought of it more as a source of cheap labour, like a family.
You're right, Professor. We might not be a traditional family like the Murphy's next door or the lesbian coven across the street. But we are a family and That Guy understands that.
Everyone's fired and we're out of business.
Oh, no!
How?
I'm gonna sell Planet Express to Mom so she can gut the company and eliminate us as competitors.
Don't let the door hit you on the way out, 'cause I don't want ass prints on my new door!
Uh, Ms. Johnson? Please bring in some more chair fuel.
I had no idea the company would be sold. I was just an innocent suck-up. You've gotta believe me!
Just leave us alone and let us clear out our lockers.
Yeah!
It's so sad, where will I go? What will I do?
You have Mrs. Darlinghaven's cotillion at 7, ma'am.
Oh. That'll be fun.
Ms. Johnson, you've never lied to me. Am I still a good person?
I don't know, sir. I'm a program built into the intercom.
I've got to redeem myself. Somehow, sometime, for some reason. I'll block this takeover!
Mr. Fry, your two o'clock magician is here.
Believe it or not, I have more important things to do today than laugh and clap my hands. Reschedule.
Sell 100 soylent beans!
Buy 3,000 cornbellies!
200 canned whoop-ass!
Three big bags of trash!
Attention, please. The takeover of PlanEx Corp. by Mom's Delivery Company will take place in the business centre in 10 minutes. I am Jor-El, master of scheduling!
OK. We've got the hot tub hot, the wine cooler's cool. It's Hammer time!
You suck!
According to regulations, both companies must approve the takeover. Planet Express shareholders, cast your votes.
Great Bonda of Uganda! We can vote against it!
I'll vote it down like a raise for school teachers!
What the--?
How the--?
Oh, no!
I neglected to mention that the shares I bought from Dr. Zoidberg gave me majority control.
Zoidberg owned 51% of the company?
The shares were worthless and he kept asking for toilet paper.
And now if Momcorp shareholders will cast their ballots.
Um ... uh... Uh, the ballot was confusing.
How about a hand recount?
OK. Ow!
The takeover of Planet Express is approved.
This stinks!
Madam is outraged.
Security, I want that bunch of rowdies outta here.
Hold on a minute!
Hey! Hey!
Momcorp will now purchase all outstanding shares of Planet Express at the current market price, which is
Ow! And also it hurt my feelings!
What are you solids griping about? Your shares are worth $107 apiece.
They are? Oh, my God! I'm a millionaire! Suddenly I have an opinion about that capital gains tax!
Yeah! Alright!
I'm even richer!
Oh! I have no shares! Wait! My sangwich! Has it also appreciated in value? Please, oh, please!
You didn't even refrigerate it, you spineless lobster!
You had to drag spines into this!
As vice chairman of Planet Express, I'd like to say a few words. There comes a time for every man who becomes rich and deserts his friends, when he goes back how it was. For me, that time is now.
So I ask you, as a friend, won't you stop this deal?
Fry, I'm an 80's guy. Friendship to me means that for two bucks I'd beat you with a pool cue till you got detached retinas. The deal will go ahead as-- My bones!
Oh, my God! His boneitis!
I was so busy being an 80's guy, I forgot to cure it. My only regret is ... that I have ... boneitis!
He's dead.
Pry out his fillings, feed him to the jackals and let's get on with the sale.
I don't think so. 'Cause, as vice chairman of the company, I gain voting control of his shares.
Don't be a fool, you idiot!

I'll be whatever I wanna do! That Guy was the greatest businessman that ever lived. And before his mysterious death, he taught me everything he knew. But some things I had to learn myself. I learned that money is fine but in the end what counts is people ... ... people you love. You can't put a price on that. So I'm giving up control of the company ... ... to a man of enormous experience ... ... Professor ... ... Hubert Farnsworth.
Oh, uh, what? I'm awake, I'm awake!
Fry! Stop doing the right thing, you jerk!
Let Mom buy the company! We all wanna be filthy, stinking rich!
Trust me, two out of three doesn't cut it!
You mean you'd rather be rich than work together?
Hell, yeah!
In my whole life, this company was the only place I'd ever really felt at home. If being millionaires is more important to you than our--
It is!
Friendship, then I'll sell Planet Express, for you.
"Millionaires" nothing! The stock's only worth three kajiggers!
Oh, come on!
My Jah! It's worth less now than when it was worthless!
It is? Yahoo! We're poor no matter what I do! The deal is off!
Aha! Once again the conservative sangwich-heavy portfolio pays off for the hungry investor! Oh! I'm ruined. Why? Why?
Look, so we're not millionaires. At least we all still get to work together.
Shut your fat mouth!
See you guys Monday!
Welcome back. Our next guest has been teaching the world to cook for over 20 years. But apparently my, uh, wife hasn't been listening.
Oh, funny!
I will destroy her! And now, extend a formulaic greeting to master chef Elzar. So, uh, Elzar, what will you be cooking for Morbo to devour with his mighty jaws?
Morbo, I'm gonna whip you up a nice, unnameable horror from beyond, with mango chutney.
Pathetic humans, prepare to write down the recipe!
Hey, uh, what's with all the pots and pans? You building a wife?
Part of one. Meantime, I'm cooking up a tasty Sunday brunch for my best friends.
Brunch. Right. I'd better warn-- tell-- warntell the others!
Okey-dokey!
Ooh!
Nice!
Yes, it's a perfect scale model of the universe's largest bottle. I put a tiny spaceship inside to keep it from being boring.
Oh!
Get--! For the last time, Zoidberg, look with your eyes, not with your claws.
Brace yourselves. Bender is making us brunch.
Oh, boy!
Oh, God! My tract!
He's so proud of his awful cooking. If we don't eat it he'll be crushed.
Alright, don't panic. If we can get to the ship, we can fly north and hide under the polar icecaps for a few weeks.
Hurry!
Good idea!
What's the hold-up?
Fleeing somewhere?
With you blocking the only escape route? Don't be silly.
In that case brunch is served! Let's go! Move it out! Stop crying, Leela!
Zoidberg, are you coming?
Sure. Me.
Because I don't want you touching that thing.
I know that. Surrender your mysteries to Zoidberg! Oh, no! Professor will hit me. But if Zoidberg fixes it, then perhaps gifts! Ow! What? Oh!
Today, I've personalised each of your meals. For example, Amy, you're cute, so I baked you a pony. Come on! Eat! I slaved all day over a filthy stove.
This is terrible!
Good thing I secretly installed this wormhole in the table.
Where does the other end come out?
You know, I'm not quite sure. Oh, dear me!
The pie is ready. You guys like swarms of things, right?
Casual hello. It's me, Zoidberg. Act naturally. Ow! Ouch! Get off of me! Stop!
How interesting, Dr. Zoidberg. Do go on.
Hey, check out the palm tree! It only gets sick when I cook brunch! How's that for a coincidence, Professor? With all your precious science!
Man, I don't wanna hurt Bender's feelings...
But this food actually tastes better as vomit!
It's unbearable! How much do you think it would cost to get my tongue removed?
And this time I mean it.
Aw, who am I kidding? It was stupid of me to ever dream of becoming a chef. I don't have what it takes and nothing can change that. Then it's settled! Elzar will teach me to cook!
Absolutely not.
But I watch your show. You owe me!
I owe you nothing! For starter's, your antenna's in my crotch. Also, I hate you. Finally, you can't cook for squat.
What was the first one again?
I hate you.
I thought that was number two.
I knocked it up a notch. Bam!
Aw, I'll never recombobulate this ship! When the Professor finds out, he'll tear me a new cloaca. Wait! What would the robot do? Frame someone!
What up?
I'm walking on sunshine! Sunshine!
It's over! My dream of being a chef is deader than the cat I'm sitting on!
Gus, old chum, let's give a friendly welcome to this new robo.
What did you call me?
A robo. You know? A robot-hobo.
Oh, OK. I thought you said "romo".
No offence intended, my filthy friend. In fact, why not join us and ride the space rails?
Get ready. We's gonna jump off at that switching prism up ahead.
We're going nearly the speed of light so, uh, roll when you land.
Ow.
Welcome to Bumbase Alpha, the biggest hobo jungle in the quadrant.
I've seen bigger. Oh, wait, I'm thinking of Eugene, Oregon. Wait. A pie with hobo-lifting aroma? Who baked it?
Helmut Spargle. He used to be the greatest chef ever.
His restaurant was so high-toned, the only way to get reservations was to create a parallel universe where you already had reservations.
Yep. I once ate there back when I what was a senator.
Yo, Spargle. If you're such a great cook, how'd you end up in this dump?
Ages ago I was the host of a TV show...
Down Home Country Kitchen Mit Helmut Spargle. But one day the extreme soda company that sponsored the show decided it was too old-fashioned.
Spargle, you're fired! We need a chef who can attract today's younger more extreme cooking show viewer.
Elzar!
Get lost, old man! Bam!
Mein soufflé!
Elzar had been seduced by the dark side of cooking. Cilantro, mango salsa, raspberry vinaigrette!
That twizzler!
As for me, I went temporarily insane and vound up here, making pies out of shoes.
My story's a lot like yours only more interesting 'cause it involves robots. That jerk Elzar ruined my dream of being a chef too.
Interesting. You wish to become a cook, but as a robot you have no sense of taste.
It's so unfair! I have eight other senses, but I'd trade them all, even smission, to be able to taste.
You don't understand. Without the distraction of taste, your mind is free to touch the Zen of pure flavour. You could become the greatest chef ever.
I could?
Yes. Just as Beethoven was a great composer because he was deaf.
Or like how Rembrandt was blind and had wooden hands.
Bender, hear me well. I shall train you. But first, you must forget everything you know about cooking.
Done.
That's right, Ricardo. A ship in a bottle! What's that? Well hang on, I'll look.
Ola? Professor? Qué pasa?
I've gathered you all here in the accusing parlour because one of you is a miniature ship wrecker.
I'm acting astonished.
Certain clues suggest that the culprit is none other than our own ... Philip J. Fry!
What?
Oh, it was a brilliant scheme. But you made one fatal mistake ... leaving this confession note.
Fry, you scoundrel!
Well, I don't remember any of that but I don't have the wherewithal to defend myself.
Then I have no choice but to charge you the full cost of the materials  $10.
There you go.
What have I done?

Your training is complete, little dessert spoon. Now, just as the man who wishes to be world chess champion must win at least one game of chess, so must you serve at least one edible meal. Succeed and I shall reveal to you the age-old secret of perfect flavour.
Ooh, yeah!
Slop's on!
Fine lookin' eats!
It is ... acceptable.
Yahoo! Another thing I'm great at! Wait. Why'd you stop eating, master?
Because ... my stomach is about to explode.
What? My dinner killed you? Oh, man!
Oh, it hurts. But don't lose confidence. The important thing is that you defeat Elzar after I am gone. And using this, you cannot fail.
A diamond vial of Mrs. Dash?
No. It is the essence of pure flavour. A few drops will cause the inner perfection of any dish to blossom forth. Oh! There goes my ... life.
I'll avenge you, master. I swear, in the presence of these drunken bums, that I shall defeat Elzar!
Oh, I'm not drunk, I'm mentally ill. But I likes what what you said!
Elzar, I'm a walking pile of your unfinished business!
Why, you--
Helmut Spargle has a message for you. He says "Ooh, I'm dead!"
Spargle, huh? What he do, bland himself to death?
No. He was eating some food I made and by a crazy coincidence his stomach exploded. Now I'm here to avenge him.
OK, but it seems like you're the one who killed him.
Maybe so but you are his sworn enemy. I challenge you to a battle of the chefs.
Scandalous!
Very well. We'll meet on the ancient televised battleground of Kitchen Coliseum. Whosever meal is best will claim the title of Iron Cook.
Iron Cook, eh? I can't lose. I'm 30% iron! You're going down! Uh, also I had a reservation for one, under "Dr. Bender".
Please welcome the superintendent of Kitchen Coliseum, Chairman Koji! No robot chef has ever competed here but today one has barged his way in to challenge for the title of...
Iron Cookuru!
Yeah! You show 'em!
Let's meet today's celebrity judges  Captain of the Harlem Globetrotters, Ethan Bubblegum Tate.
Konnichiwa, brother!
TV anchor-monster, Morbo.
Greetings, pathetic host.
And a woman who ended a thousand-year galactic war with her apple dandies, Martha Stewart's head.
The secret is fresh pork.
And now, Chairman Koji will present the theme ingredient to be used in every dish today.
If it's chicken, chicken c la king; if it's fish, fish à la king; if it's turkey, fish à la king.
Soylent Greuu!
Soylent Green, a classic ingredient of gourmet cooking. And the battle is on. Aki, what's Elzar making?
Well, Hiroki-san, when I asked him, he asked what business it was of mine and conjectured that my mother was a prostitute.
In the English countryside many prostitutes decorate their rooms with festive gourds.
30 minutes to go.
Look at Bender roll that dough!
I've never seen such confident, powerful strokes of the ass!
You've never seen mine!
No, I haven't!
Fifteen minutes remaining.
The iron cook is bringing in his signature creation, a working pastry replica of downtown Venice.
Commemorative turkey basters. Get your commemorative turkey basters.
Yo, hook me up. My turkey is dry and I've tried everything. Oh, right. Never mind.
Oh, the guilt! The unbearable guilt!
Fifteen seconds.
Bam!
Ten seconds.
Master Spargle, if you can hear me up there in that ditch where I left you, this is for you.
Time uperuu!
The iron cook Neptunian has gone all out to please the judges. He's even garnished the salad with $100 bills. Let's see what they think.
Mmm. Soylent green is my kind of people!
Scrumptious. Morbo will store this in his sack for future digestion.
I'm swimming in my own soylent waste. It's a good thing.
Next up, challenger Bender. A student of the legendary Helmut Spargle, Bender is some sort of wonderful mechanical man.
Ooh, delicious!
This food looks kind of funky, but it tastes kind of fun-kay!
The challenger's ugly food has shown us that even hideous things can be sweet on the inside.
And now, judgement. The winner will become the new iron cook, the loser is doomed to scrub. Whose confection will achieve perfection? Whose foodstuff will be the good stuff?
Challengeruu Benderuu!
Yay!
That's my robot! I own him!
You honour me, Chairman Koji.
Domo arigato, Mr. Roboto.
Chairman-san, I came here with one goal  To humiliate Elzar in a large stadium. I believe I've done that.
No question.

But the true Zen of flavour is not found in a coliseum. It is found in a small kitchen, with friends. That is why I decline the title of Iron Cook and accept only the lesser title of "Zinc Saucier", which I just made up. Also, it comes with double prize money.

Wait! Everyone must know  I broke the Professor's bottled ship. And what is worse, I framed my dearest friend, Fry! I can never repay him his ten dollars, so I must take the only honourable path. What the killing myself. Here I go, already. Huh?
Oh! That sword cost 5000 dolluu!
Fry did it!
And that's how I defeated Elzar, thanks to Spargle's magic liquid.
Yes, we were there. And we just finished watching it again on TV.
Hmm. Let me see that vial, Bender. Good Lord! According to the spectrolizer, Spargle's magic ingredient was ... water. Ordinary water!
No!
Ah, so the real gift Spargle gave you was confidence. The confidence to be your best.
Yes, ordinary water. Laced with nothing more than a few spoonfuls of LSD.
The important thing is, by my standards, I won fair and square. Now, who wants brunch? Cooked with plenty of ... "confidence"?
I'm in!
I do!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Indeed.

Line: Any calls while I was out?

Line: Yeah. You got a tele-sonic transmission from Kif a couple hours ago.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: My Kiffie called? Kif?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Ooh, Amy, you're back. Another hour and I would have thought about hanging up.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Why didn't you just leave a message, sweetie?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Well, um, I've left hundreds of messages with your answering machine but you never seem to get them.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Bender!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Not my fault if you don't check me! Messages erased.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Oh, dearest, this long-distance relationship is too much to bear. When even an inch separates us, I quiver with misery. So you can imagine how I feel when it's a billion light years.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Kif, don't cry, or you'll get a tummy ache.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Lieutenant, some things came off me and clogged the drain, so if you could-- Oh, ho! What's this?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Well, well, well! Do my eyes believe me or is that my bosom-y swan, Leela?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Say again. You're breaking up!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Good news, everyone! You'll be delivering pain medicine to the hive mind of Nigel 7.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Scruffy's rollin' out a large pill!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: You're going to Nigel 7? Kif's on patrol near there. You could drop me off on the way.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: We could but we won't! It's a spaceship, damnit, not a prom limousine! If anyone needs me I'll be in the Angry Dome.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: This is a very long trip. So we'll all have to go into hibernative-naptosis to save oxygen.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: I don't even breathe oxygen!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Here I come, Kif!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: They jumped right out of their pants! Oh, what now? Activate glass window. Kif, I'm sensing a very sensual disturbance in the force. Prepare for ship-to-ship intimacy!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Yes, sir, captain!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: How 'bout I help you finish that dream you were having about me?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: OK. I was just at this part  Yah!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Uh, let's try that a little lower and a lot softer!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Imagine you stowing away and stealing a licensed starship! Oh, it's so romantic it gives me the shivers!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: I don't care how much trouble I get in. I needed to feel my lips pressed against your lipless beak.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Oh, Amy, I can't stand having a whole universe between us. I've been thinking a lot about this and, well, would you move in with me?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Here? But, uh, wouldn't it be crowded?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: No, no! It's really twice the size. You can use the floor and I'll have the ceiling. See?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Kif! You have so much creativity and niceness, but I'm not ... ... sure if I--

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Hush! Before you answer, come thither.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: This is the Holo-Shed. It can simulate anything you desire, and nothing can hurt you. Except when it malfunctions and the holograms become real.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Well, that probably won't happen this time.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: I wanted to show you what life would be like if we were together. Computer  Run program "Kif 1".

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: This is so beautiful! Spirit! Kif, that's the pony I always wanted but my parents said I had too many ponies already.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Yes, I programmed it in for you. 4 million lines of BASIC! And if this isn't the life you want, how 'bout this? Run program "Kif 2".

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Oh, Kif!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: We could live here at the shore of the Tranquilibrius Sea in a timeshare. And I would pluck the moon from the sky just to see you smile. Almost got it. It seems to be ... sort of ... stuck! I love you! Run program "Kif //3".

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: This isn't bad. My aunt had a place like this.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Amy, we could live in a bus station bathroom for all I care. As long as we're together, it'll feel like a castle to me.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Kif, I'd love to live with you ... someday. But before then there's still lots I wanna do on my own. What was that?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Oh, dear. I fear the Holo-Shed might be broken again. Well, as long as we don't cross paths with Attila the--

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Look! Spirit!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: And there's Professor Moriarty, Jack the Ripper, Evil Lincoln!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Right-oh, gents, it's another simulation gone mad, so murder and mayhem, standard procedure!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Rampage!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Real holographic-simulated Evil Lincoln is back!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: The Holo-Shed's on the fritz again! The characters turned real!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Damn. The last time that happened I got slapped with three paternity suits. Listen up, history's greatest villains... Get back into the Holo-Shed before I start blasting!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Stop! Don't shoot fire stick in space canoe! Cause explosive decompression!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Spare me your space-age techno-babble, Attila the Hun!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Hey!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Kif! Hold on!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: I totally want to!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Grab on!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Over here!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Please hold me!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Have a good one! Oh, man!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: After all that I could use some relaxation. I'll be in the Holo-Shed.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Well, except for a few broken bones, some internal haemorrhaging and a partially barfed-up heart, everyone appears fine. Oh, and Kif is pregnant.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Oh, joy!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Amy, isn't it wonderful? I'm pregnant!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Yes it's ... great. A great miracle.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: And not one of those bogus everyday miracles like a sunrise. Aren't you a male?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Yeah, what's the deal? Just when I thought I'd figured out you biological creatures, it's something else! Lemme at 'im! Come over here, Kif! You--

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Look, I'm sure we're all a little unclear on how anyone gets pregnant. So, Kif, pray explain. And don't spare the dirty words where appropriate.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Well, it's quite simple really. When one of my species experiences deep feelings of love we enter a so-called "receptive state".

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: You disgust me! Go on.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: At that point, our skin becomes a semi-permeable membrane, which allows the passage of genetic material. I held Amy's hand and voilà.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Well, OK. But that better be all there is!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Oh, Amy! You'll be a mother!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: What a wondrous affirmation of our love. And all from the touch of your hand.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Dude, hold up. Remember when Zapp blew a hole in the ship?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Indeed.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Kif touched everybody there. Couldn't any one of us be the mother?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Hey, yeah! I mean ... what about that, Kif?

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Well, I suppose I might have gotten pregnant that way. Or even from a toilet seat. Though that's impossible since I have a private washroom.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Ah, my home away from home. By the way, Kif, your flush seemed to be set on stun, not kill.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Look, Kif, I probably am the mother. Although maybe I'm not. Of course, I hope I am. But just in case I'm not, maybe we should have a test.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: A test! I demand a test!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Even I laughed at me when I built this alien cross-species genetic analyser. But I guess I showed myself! Subjects, please enter the chamber. Now to take a DNA sample. When I pull this switch, the maternifuge will spin at 10,000 RPM, separating out everyone who isn't the mother-- Father-- Whatever!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Faster! Faster!

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Good. Fry's ejection indicates that he is not the man-mom. Nor is Captain Brannigan.

Episode: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Line: Oh, thank you, merciful God!
