It's all over. Our guns and bombs are useless against the aliens.
The saucers! Theys'a crashin'!
In the end, it was not guns or bombs that defeated the aliens, but that humblest of all God's creatures, the Tyrannosaurus Rex.
I can't believe TiVo suggested that piece of... Ow! Come on, Hermes. Surely you have the authority to remove this damn collar.
Alas, no. I got the key but not the authority.
Yeow! Well, who does have the authority?
Only the staff doctor. You'll have to convince him that you have resolved your anger issues.
I don't have any god da- mother f- anger issues.
Bender and the boys are playing Dungeons & Dragons.]
As your dwarf-skin canoe rounds a bend you suddenly see... A terrifying red dragon.
What do we do? What do we do?
Wait, I know. I make use of my rod of fireballs.
Everyone knows red dragons are immune to fireballs as well as all other forms of incendiary attack.
Yes, but I aim not at the dragon but at the river itself to create a shroud of steam through which we can escape.
Whoa!
Sweet pony of Sierra Leone, it worked!
We did it!
Success!
Bender, smell this milk.
I go not by the name of Bender, you fleshy fool. I am Titanius Anglesmith, fancy man of Cornwood.
Professor, something's bothering me.
Well, you can always talk to me about anything, Fry. What's on your mind?
Well, it's... it's about my friend Bender.
Mmm. I see. Show me on this anatomically correct doll exactly where he touched you.
No, it's nothing like that. It's just that I am worried about him. He's being playing an awful lot of Dungeons & Dragons.
Dungeons &... Good God! Hasn't he seen the Afterschool Special? You've got to talk to him, Fry. Make him quit now before he completely loses his mind.
Okay, I will.
Good boy. Just don't let him touch you down there.
Well, here's your problem, right here. You've got a skull embedded in your head.
You're absolutely right, Doctor. Can the collar come off now?
Let me just peel your head a little and see if I can get that skull out.
So, you tell me, little miss expert, why always with the temper? Calm down for once and think. Here, enjoy a relaxing spritz from my empathy bladder.
What is it, already? What's the cause of your anger?
I guess I would have to say, I hate you.
I'm beginning to understand. It all goes back to your parents.
What?
They pushed you to study medicine when all you ever wanted was to be a song-and-dance man. Why? Whyyy?
I was raised in an orphanarium. My parents are sewer mutants who I never even met until a few years ago.
Then you've got to go to them and work this song-and-dance stuff out. Maybe have them cook me nice dinner. No scallions. I hate them. (To an intercom ) Amy, cancel my appointments.
Stop calling me.
Bender, please don't get mad, but I think you might be playing too much Dungeons & Dragons.
You're absolutely right, Fry. I almost went insane, but after this heart-to-heart talk, I've decided to quit.
Really? Whew! That's a load off my toad.
Now, if you'll excuse me. I'm off to slay the werewolf of Goblin Mountain.
On guard, man-wench! Prepare to cross blades.
You couldn't afford it, honey.
Foolish leprechaun, I scoop your treasure in the name of the fancy men.
He also left a small pile of treasure on the living room rug.
Foul dragon, meet thy doom.
Would you like a napkin, Doctor?
Thank you.
Satisfied, Zoidberg? My relationship with my parents is fine.
Now, hold on, Leela. Maybe this torture collar is good for you.
What? Ow!
It'll control your temper. Men like a woman who's not always slamming their head in the car door.
She's right. That's what first attracted me to your mother.
So, Leela, I understand your friend here is a physician, and I'm not seeing a ring on his claw.
Mom, he's a cockroach from outer space.
Good, Leela, work that anger out. Excuse me a moment, I'm swarming with parasites.
Hey, it's what's-his-name from the surface. The bi-clops.
Ha-have you seen Bender? He's gone nuts. Also, smell this milk.
Prepare for a surprise attack.
Someone do something.
I would, but... Ow! Take my collar off.
I can't, I'm still eating. Help me, Leela.
I cast upon thee a spell of fireball!
No. Not the spork.
Beholdeth, Titanius, I cast a freeze ray upon you.
That's ridiculous. There's no such thing as a "freeze ray." What, you mean a cone of coldness?
Yeah, that.
No! No! Fancy men are defenseless against cone of coldness. I'm freezing... what? Ah!
Bender, no. When will young people learn that Dungeons & Dragons won't make you cool?
Relax, Fry. I'm a doctor. I'm sure the robut will be just fine with a little help.
Help, help. (Echoing ) Help!
Previously, on Futurama. Hah-haa!
A terrifying red dragon!
I make use of my rod of fireballs.
The collar will be triggered any time your thoughts turn to violence.
Ouch!
Bender, I think you might be playing too much Dungeons & Dragons.
You're absolutely right, Fry. Now, if you'll excuse me. I'm off to slay the werewolf of Goblin Mountain.
Please, send in the patient.
Yes, Doctor.
Wee!
So, (Low monotone voice ) Bender, (Normal voice )I understand you're having trouble separating fantasy from reality.
Says who? Was it the bugbear? Is he talking about me again?
I understand. Commence therapy.
Poor Bender. Says here to tell his friends he's at a spa.
So what happened to Bender?
He's at a spa.
Wow, there's a spa in the nut house?
Friends, friends, stop everything. There's food in this shaker.
Ow! Can you please remove this anger collar?
Are you still angry?
No. Ow!
It also shocks you when you lie.
Quiet, everyone. The network news is on and if I, a 165-year-old man, don't watch it, who will?
Thankfully, the amazing talking horse was rescued and safely returned to the meat department.
Turning to the less stupid portion of our broadcast, fuel prices hit an all-time high today due to the ongoing dark matter shortage.
Earlier, our own Morbo sat down with Mom, CEO of Mom's Friendly Multinational Energy Conglomerate.
Morbo the Annihilator, here, sitting down to a delightful tea in this fake living room set. (Shouting ) Thank you for joining us, Mom.
My pleasure, sugarplum.
Mom, you control the world's only dark matter mine. Why are fuel prices so high?
Oh! It's terrible, isn't it? Dark matter is just so rare nowadays, but we'll keep pinching loaf after loaf from the bowels of the earth, even if I lose money on every log.
If you are losing money, how did you post record profits last quarter?
You look thin, care for one of my famous pecan clusters?
Morbo shouldn't. It will go straight to Morbo's gargantuan forehead. Oh, what the heck? I guess I could destroy one or two of them.
Do people care enough to drill for dark matter even in an Alaskan wildlife refuge? People do.
Greedy old hag, taste the wrath of my fuzzy slipper.
Professor, why are you so hot and dusty over this dark matter shortage?
Oohh... I bet you'd like to know. I bet you'd like to know, indeed.
Hello, Mother. How did the interview go?
It made me want to puke my face off. Where's my Thigh Blaster?
Right here, Mom.
Shut up!
Okay, thank you.
Burn, you damn thighs. Burn!
Mommy, are you upset 'cause of the dark matter shortage?
There is no shortage, you moronic ass-brain!
There's not? But you said...
Allow me to explain. Suppose this hand represents current reserves of dark matter and this hand represents consumer demand.
Uh-huh.
I just bet you'd like to know why I'm so angry about this dark matter shortage. I bet very much you'd like to know.
You're right, Professor. We would like to know.

Really? I didn't think anyone was interested. It all started 30-odd years ago. I was working in Mom's laboratories for the third time after twice before realizing how evil she was and vowing never to work for her again. But somehow the rich, wrong stench of her boney charms kept calling me back.
Don't stop, Professor. I'm getting aroused.

Back in those days, dark matter was just a worthless inert curiosity, and I was smashing it in a particle accelerator, in an ill-conceived attempt to create a more durable harpsichord wax. But, as Deepak Chopra taught us, quantum physics means anything can happen at any time for no reason. Also, eat plenty of oatmeal and animals never had a war. Who's the real animals? And thus against all probabilities... it happened. [The dark matter particles in the particle accelerator begin colliding and exploding. A large explosion leaves only a single item - the single non-local metaparticle crystal.
Dang!
I'm sure I don't need to explain that all dark matter in the universe is linked in the form of a single non-local meta-particle.
Guhh! Stop patronizing us.

So, in one instant, I had transformed all dark matter everywhere into a new crystalline form... (Younger Farnsworth to Younger Mom ) ...making it the most potent fuel since primitive man first ignited mastodon flatulence to heat his cave.
I'm intrigued, Hubert. You have my undivided attention.
Shut up, you milk-sucking leeches! A new super fuel, eh? We're rich.
Indeed, we are.
Not you, we. Us, we. I'm getting back together with my ex-husband.
Wernstrom!
You've been played, Farnsworth. Played like a cheap harpsichord.
Walt, fire that employee like Mommy taught you.
Professor, maybe I can help you get even with Mom. I spend most of my time thinking about how to get revenge on a bad boss.
Me, too.
Ditto!
Likewise.
I made a blinding powder.

Thanks, but that won't be necessary because I have the ultimate weapon. You see, in the instant the energy crystal was created, there also came into being an opposite crystal made of pure anti-backwards energy.
Wow!
So?
So, this! If ever the two crystals should meet, their wave functions would collapse like Raymond Burr's trampoline, once again rendering all dark matter inert and useless as fuel.
But then we'll have no fuel.
But once we free society from dependence on Mom's dark matter, scientists will finally care enough to develop cleaner, alternative fuels.
Scientists like you!
No, not me. I'm too busy developing makeup for dogs. That's where the money is.
This is our chance to teach Mom a lesson. Let's take the anti-crystal and shove it up Mom's regular crystal.
Yeah.
Fight the power!
There's just one, small problem, and it's a big one. I hid the crystal and I can't remember where.
Surely it's just a matter of waiting till you next move your bowels and then using a potato masher...
Don't you think I already tried that? No. I'm afraid, the crystal is lost forever.
Nine? You did it. You outwitted the fungus.
Woohoo!
Who needs girls?
Since you have all proven resistant to individualized hammer therapy, I now prescribe group therapy.
Everything must be clean, very clean. That's why the dog had to die. He was a dirty dog. Dirty, dirty. Also, that boy, Elroy. Dirty, dirty.
Who would like to share their feelings?
I feel unappreciated at work.
What? I can barely understand you.
I said I feel...
Change places.
Well, well. Looks like old Roberto is the focus of attention now. Stop looking at me.
Calm down, Roberto. Tell us about your childhood.
I was designed by a team of engineers attempting to build an insane robot. But it seems they failed.
Um, actually...
Look, we have to accept the fact that we all have a serious problem.
Amen.
Good, Bender.
That's right.
There's a band of river trolls living in the moat and they may have no intention of letting us out of this castle, unless we hand over the Golden Scepter of Zanthor.
Say what? Dude's crazy.
Bender, please, try to...
I know not of this Bender. I am Titanius Anglesmith, fancy man of Cornwood.
You are suffering a breakdown. I'm in your seat. I forgot we had changed places.
Good news, everyone!
You perfected dog mascara?

Far from it. If you ask me, they look like a bunch of hookers. But what I have invented is a means of locating the missing crystal. When I push this button, the crystal will emit a high-frequency stink.
Hurray!
There. Now, with any luck I'll detect it with my smelling aid. I just pray to all powerful Atheismo that we find it before Mom does.
Do you smell the crystal, Professor?
No, damn it! Just the alluring scent of Obsession for spaniels.
Dude. Who whipped an egger? CubertHe who smelled it, dealt it.
Well, he who denied it, supplied it.
Well, he who articulated it, particulated it.
Well, he who refuted it, tooted it.
Stalemate.
Jesus craps. The anti-backwards crystal.
Ow! Ah... sorry?

Relax, it's not your fault. I can't believe it still exists. Google the hell out of that skanker. Planet-sucking-Express? Of course. How could I have been so dumb? With that crystal, Farnsworth could completely destroy my dark matter empire. I underestimated that sagging old bag of bones and gonads.
Is that man bad?
Very bad, Igner. And that's why I need you three to go steal the anti-crystal away from him. But be careful. You'll need all your stoogely cunning.
Exterminators.
Oh, great. What do we got? Wall gophers? Toilet snails?
No, I'm afraid you've got owls. Over there, see?
Ow!
Dump the bag, you nitwit.
Hey, watch it.
Quiet, you. Ow!
I was looking over there for a long time but I didn't see any... Oh, there they are. Gross.
We've got to act fast. Larry, get out the geigersniffer.
You're just gonna hit me with it.
No. I'm going to hit you with this.
Those three exterminators are hilarious.
Really? I don't think so.
Me, neither. Now, Sex and the City, that's funny.
After wandering aimlessly in the swamp, you suddenly... wander aimlessly in the swamp.
There it is.
Uh, excuse you.
I'm sorry, little boy. You see, we're owl exterminators.
We are owl extermin... Ow!
And what we have here is an owl egg that's about to hatch into an owl larva. So, if you don't mind, we'll just take this and...
What are you, stupid? That's a dodecahedral crystal I found hidden in the downstairs walrus tank.
And I wrote numbers on it so we could use it as a D12, 'cause I have the best handwriting.
Do not.
Do too.
Do not.
Do too.
You win this round.
What's going on here?
We're owl exterminators.
Oh? Then you won't have any problem exterminating this owl.
My anti-backwards crystal. So it's you three. I should have known Mom would send her brainless brood to do her dirty work. Walt, the leader among imbeciles.
Hey! They resent that.
Larry, the snivelling middle child.
Sorry. Thank you.
And you, Igner. The evil I could tolerate, but the stupidity...
We're owl exterminators.
Good God. Just knowing we're in the same genus makes me embarrassed to call myself homo. Now, get out and tell Mom thanks for the crystal.
Thanks for the crystal.
There. The repairs are complete.
Let's go, already. We've got to infiltrate Mom's dark matter mine, now. How do you start this thing? Good Lord, woman. Can you move any slower? Rake up some dark matter and top off the tank.
Well, there isn't any dark matter. Nibbler hasn't pooped at all. And he ate a whole family of koalas last night. Nibbler! Nibbler!
I'm not interested in the whereabouts of your cutesy-fruitsy space rat. The only thing that matters right now is this crystal.
Ow!
And be careful with that crystal.

Bender is laying flat in a chair. He has mice and spiders crawling all over him, there is an alarm sounding off, the lights are flashing and there is a axe device swinging close to his head like a pendulum.]
(Muffled chanting.) Death to ogres!
Even relaxation therapy has failed. Nurse, schedule a robotomy for Bender.
Yes, Doctor. I'll get the tools from the shed.
It's a very painful procedure. So until then, just try to relax.
What are you laughing at?
Your laugh. It's just so infectious.
So's herpes. Now, shut up! You and Walt, lead the killbots to the surface and blow Farnsworth out of the sky.
What about Igner?
That hairless ape? I swear. When he came out I flipped a coin whether to keep him or the after-birth.
Yes, Mother. You told that story at his graduation.
I'm afraid he can't be trusted on this mission. You see, there is a terrible secret about Igner I've never told anyone. And here it is.
Continue returning fire.
What?
What did they say?
I don't know. I can't hear a thing.
Hey, what's everybody talking about?
Mayday! Mayday! Oh, God. I cannot believe this is the best plan I could come up with. We weren't actually in the ship.
Okay, team, these red-hot, razor-sharp fans are the only safe way into the mine.
Hmm, uh, ladies first. Phew! That blade missed me by the skin of my pants.
Maintenance shaft 7 serving...
Shut your mouth.
I'm just talking about the shaft.
Jeez, doesn't that shock collar hurt?
Actually, feels kind of good. I guess I'm starting to associate it with the pleasure of beating people up.
We shot them down, Mother. The intruders never even got to Sector 1.
Intruders in Sector 15. Intruders in Sector 15.
Ugh... Sometimes I don't know why I even bother to slap you. (on PA ) All Killbots to Sector 15.
What did she say?
What did you say?
There are so many killbots behind us I can't count them all. Three, I think.
We're trapped.
The main pit must be in here. I'm detecting vast quantities of Dark Matter.
Step aside turkey-neck. I think I know the code.
We're in. We're in the heart of the mine. The very source of all Mom's wealth and...
My God! This isn't a crap mine. It's a crap farm.
Is there really so much of a distinction? I mean...
(From offscreen ) Leela, it's me, Nibbler.
Oh, my God, you look horrible, Nibbler. I think I'm going to vomit.
Nibbler is over there.
Oh, sorry. Nibbler!
Previously, on puny Futurama. Mwaah!
Foolish leprechaun, I scoop your treasure in the name of the fancy men.
Bender, I think you might be playing too much Dungeons & Dragons.
I know not of this Bender. I am Titanius Anglesmith, fancy man of Cornwood.
Please, send in the patient.
Wee!
The collar will be triggered any time your thoughts turn to violence.
Ouch!
Jeez, doesn't that shock collar hurt?
Actually, I guess I'm starting to associate it with the pleasure of beating people up.
Mom, you control the world's only dark matter mine.
My God! This isn't a crap mine. It's a crap farm.
Oh, my poor little snuzzy-wuzzams. Are they treating you okay?
No, they are force-feeding us so we poop more dark matter. It's horrible. Those are good. You've got to help us.
Help us!
Help us, for God's sakes!
Nibbler made a bo-bo.
But not on my terms. I will not be treated like... Hey, wait, aren't you amazed I can speak?
Well, actually, no. You forgot to blank our memories after you spoke last time.
Then why did you let me eat Friskies and make bo-bo in a litter box?
Well, you're cuter that way.
Cute as a baby's buttocks.
So what happened? How did Mom capture all you Nibblonians?

It all began 36 years ago... Now! On the planet Vergon 6. (VO ) It was a veritable Eden, brimming with unique and irreplaceable species. Most of which were delicious. I was Supreme Fuzzler of a Nibblonian scientific outpost. It was paradise, until they came. One of your DOOP ships struck dark matter, little realizing it was not a natural deposit, but rather centuries of Nibblonian fecal material.
The big faecal enchilada. Anyone else hungry?
The DOOP contracted a ruthless businesswoman to spearhead the mining operation.
Let me guess. Mom?
The very same.
Can I also guess Mom?
To reduce cost she started a new enterprise, Mom's Friendly Robots, to build robot slaves. Remember this was back in the days before Robot Lincoln.
Faster, faster!
I'm going exactly as fast as you built me to go.
Oh, wise guy, huh?
Ow!

Eventually, the planet was mined down to a hollow shell and my people were forced to evacuate. Alas, I had eaten a day-old Swinosaur for lunch. And while doing some evacuating of my own, I was left behind. [He makes noises that often accompany bowel movements. Mom is watching him Mom  So, that's where it comes from. We may have a whole new source of Dark Matter on our hands.
Eww!
As it turned out I was the lucky one. Unbeknownst to me, Mom captured my colleagues and enslaved them here in this... this... crap farm.
There's nothing to do but eat and crap, eat and crap. It's like visiting my parents.
As for me, I emerged from behind the "bush of many uses" to find I had been left behind. I was doomed, doomed.
Hello, there.
Startled, my cuteness reflex kicked in.
I'll call him Nibbler.
A silly name for a high-ranking Fuzzler. But, hey, I was glad to be rescued.
But then, how did you end up here with the others?
I was kidnapped yesterday by Mom's vile sons in their moronic disguises.
I was an owl exterminator. Do you have the crysal?
It's pronounced "crystal," you lump.
Go, run fast.
Did you see anyone?
Me?
Yes, you. You're the only one here.
If I'm the only one here, then how could I see anyone?
He's got a point, Walt.
So does my knee.
This wouldn't be so bad if it weren't for the chickens.
Don't worry, those clamps are for my own protection.
Do you know where you are, Bender?
Sure do, I'm in the magical land of Cornwood, frolicking with wenches.
Close. You're in the loony bin for a robotomy.
Can't you just use the access panel?
Either way is fine.
Does anyone else smell burning dragon beak?
Wherever you are, Farnsworth, my boys will find you.
They've eluded us, Mother. But rest assured, we've already slapped each other, so there's no need to...
You'll thank me some day when you are slapping your own kids. I know Farnsworth's game. He is going to try to poke his clammy old crystal at my hot fiery crystal.
Mom!
If the crystals get within six inches of each other... Wham! All my dark matter will be worthless.
Get them!
Ooh. That feels good.
Oh, for crying out... Oh, the freaking battery's dead. Walt, where's the charger?
In the hardware drawer, Mother.
Damn tangled mess of wires.

We're almost there. The crystals are beginning to engorge. I can't quite reach. Fry, grab onto my easy-fit waistband. Just a few more inches. Come on, really wedgie it on in there. So, that's why they call me the Catman.
Nobody move. I've found the charger. Hang on. I'm on it. Okay, there!
Save us, Catman.
It's over, Hubert. Give me the anti-backwards crystal.
Never!
Oh, bravo. You're in a crap-harvesting factory, genius. Walt! Larry! Start harvesting.
No!
I will now delicately jerk out your imagination, severing fantasy's grip on your nerd-circuit.
Cornwood!
Illogical. Illogical.
But, Doctor, I love you.
Oh, what now?
This is crazy. Ow! What the... You okay, Leela?
I think so.
Wait a second. Is there something different about your hooves?
Oh, Lord. I'm half-horse and half-naked.
Where the hell are we, hell?
Bender?
I know not of this Bender. I'm Titanius Anglesmith. Welcome to Cornwood!
Wretched peasants, put aside your cares and feast on the succulent flesh of the roast munchkin!
Care for a slice of scroto?
Uh... that's his name, right?
'Tis also that, sir.

We're honored this eve by a visit from my friends of old, Frydo and Leegola. So let the dwarves do their gay dance and let the gnomes play their sissy piccolos. Dance! Dance, you little freaks. Faster. Faster!
My ankle!
To the kitchen with him!
Wait! Wait! Wait! I do impressions. Behold! The swamp hag  "Get out of my swamp, you kids!"
Don't let him get too crispy.
Lord Anglesmith.
You have ridden hard, noble squire. May I offer you a horn of ale and a shank of dwarf?
'Tis dire news, sire. Dark riders approach.
You shall be handsomely rewarded, sir knight. We ride at once! Oops! Frydo! Saddle up that trusty steed.
What's happening? And why am I enjoying it so much?
Foul beast-bags! Meet thy doom!
Follow me.
Damn thee, Ignus.
Well, you said to follow you.
Well, now I say follow this!
The Die of Power! He's rolling it.
Oh, no!
I'm back bab-...
Seven.
"Banish foes"? Cool.
No! No!
I got to say, I had no idea the Die of Power was so powerful.
Did you have any idea of...
Get out of my swamp, you kids!
I can't believe I'm saying this, but that was really exciting. I've never felt so alive. What else can we slay? Is that a hobbit over there?
No, that's a hobo and a rabbit. But they're making a hobbit.
Thank God, an outhouse.
Hush! This be no outhouse, but the lair of the great wizard Grayfarn.
Who is it?
'Tis I, Titanius.
Just a moment.
Methinks the wizard be casting a powerful spell, indeed.
Come in! Come in! Yes. 'Tis a powerful object in both our worlds. If you failed to destroy it in yours, perhaps you were brought here that you might have a second chance.
So, this land is real?
Oh, dreadfully real. If you die here, you'll really be dead. But instead of science, we believe in crazy hocus-pocus. It's like Kansas.
God help us.
Cornwood's troubles began hundreds or perhaps millions of years ago. (VO ) Deep in the Geysers of Gygax, Momon herself injection-molded the Dice of Power from the living plastic.
Damn, these are hot.
Ah ha! In our universe she's called Mom.

In your universe, are you taught not to interrupt? Evidently not. Anyway, Momon spawned three rotten sons, whom you've already had the displeasure of meeting. Waltazar, Larius, and the dumbest of all, the halfwit Ignus, bastard son of Momon and the brainless He-demon. Curse you, Momon, queen of all that is evil and not very good in bed. And I'm not just saying that because she dumped me. (VO ) Yes, I was once her consort. I was blinded by love, and later, scorpion venom. I'm blind! (Out of flashback ) But Momon has one weakness. She put too much of her power into this. The generalissimo of dice.
Well, bite my shiny metal face.

Don't be foolish, Titanius. If you had paid attention in freshman alchemy, instead of frequenting the bawdyhouse, you'd know there's only one way to destroy it. In the boiling plastic from which it was molded.
Like that machine that makes wax lions at the zoo.
Quiet, you. We must infiltrate the Geysers of Gygax, the impenetrable stronghold of Momon.
Impossible. Impossible, I say.
No, Titanius. For we maintain one advantage, the element of surprise.
The crew is walking through a light forest.]
Verily, our quest has begun.
Stop right there.
Hermes?
He's a centaur like me.
You wish.
I am Hermaphrodite, most beautiful of centaurs. Gaze upon me and weep at my loveliness.
Very well.
Loveliest of centaurs, we seek to end Momon's reign of evil. Have you stout fighters at your command?
One thousand archers of truest aim. Fire!
Hey guys, I forgot I had this pumpkin.
I knew it. My people are mighty warriors. Our enemies will be like Swiss cheese with blood coming out of the holes.
We centaurs are creatures of peace.
Oh, Lord.
Violence is never justified. We shall not join your quest. And furthermore, if mayhem be your intent, you may not cross our lands.
Or what?
Or... Uh... Mmm?
We're not there, we're here.
No, this way.
I mean, here.
Thank you, kindly, Treedledum.
Okey-doke. Anything else I can do?
You know who I'm gonna miss? That tree guy.
Bad news, fancy men. Momon's guards stand watch at the pass. 'Tis as if she somehow anticipated us.
And so our quest comes to an end. I only regret not giving up sooner.
Fret not, Titanius. For we still have one hope, the Cave of Hopelessness.
Let me know how that turns out.
Halt. Are you on the list? I'm not seeing you on the list.
I'll split this doofus in half.
Wait, I got it. Yeah. My cousin's in the band. The band of merry men. Please, we were already in there. I just need to go back for my coat.
I am Gynecaladriel, queen of the water nymphos.
All right. I'll split this doofus in half.
Stand aside and I will use my powers to overwhelm the guard. Behold, the deed is done.
Hi oh!
Mr. Wizard, why is this place called the Cave of Hopelessness?
Oh, fear not, lad. 'Tis named for its discoverer, Reginald Hopelessness...
Whew!
...the first man to be eaten alive by the Tunneling Horror.
What's that? The Tunneling Horror?
No, it's morcs.
Hey, listen. Nanu, nanu. Shazbot.

We must melt it in the super bombastic, bubbling plastic from whence it came.

The Eviscerator is one of the finest, if not the finest, tactical folder on the market today. We're talking 440 stainless, quick release and... I don't believe this. Is this a stag horn handle at this price?

At this price? You have got to be kidding me. That's got to be some kind of mistake, right there.

Now, you folks at home, I know what you're thinking. You're thinking, that can't be stag horn. It's got to be the cheaper manticore horn. But, I've got the specs right here and I'll tell you what, this is the real deal.

1101-1816 is the item number on this one.

Ow!

Exactly. You can't make that kind of stuff up.

Line: But, Skip, that was your lucky robot's foot what came off of your lucky leg.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: While it is true that I did wake up with only one foot this morning, there is no proof that my beloved Fanny was involved. Aside from the hacksaw I found under her pillow.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Well, what about that Bender guy? You want I should give him the clamps?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Not yet, Clamps. We are gonna sit tight and see if he wins the poker tournament. He does, that proves he's packing my lucky foot, in which event...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: The clamps! Or a clamp-like device.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Welcome viewers who fell asleep with the TV on! It's the 3009 no-limit hold 'em championship. I'm the massive head of Penn Jillette, and here with a color commentary, my partner Teller. Our act really didn't change much when he died.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Pardon me, I'm new to this game. Is this duffle bag big enough for all your money?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Bender? Oh, boogers. We're in the same tournament. Quick, get your entry fee back before I bankrupt you.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Pfft! In your dreams, nutloaf.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Bite my shiny metal hat.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Tex Connecticut, the pride of Kansas City, first to act. Smiley Spiff, up next. Looks like Boobs Vanderbilt has a decent pair. Also, she's got two eights. And Bender Rodriguez picks up a lucky deal right off the bat.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Woo! Two aces. I'm thinking guitar solo.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: He puts his hat back down.] I fold.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Holy crap! A stunning play by mentally ill newcomer Philip Fry. It's almost as if he knew Bender had two aces.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Bender has two aces? I'm out.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: I'm out.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: I'm out.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Suck my luck!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: See this gun? That's what I'm gonna do to Bender if he wins.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: All in. Call my mighty bid at your peril. (Telepathically)  My cards are awful, and I need a hug.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: I call your bluff.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: I shall annihilate... Fry hugs him.] (Sobbing ) I just wanted to make my daddy proud.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Well, you didn't. I want you and your junk moved out by Monday.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: It's getting pretty intense, folks. Based on the state of decomposition of Teller's head, we're now in hour 19 of the tournament. And the first bad deal of the night for Bender.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Hey, pal, help me out here. This is the worst possible hand, right?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: I'm all in.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: All in! I mean, fold. Whatever.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Well, Bender's luck just ran out. No card can save him from elimination.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Oh, my gourds! He's dead.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: 21, winner!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Wooo! I'm so full of luck, it's shooting out like luck diarrhoea.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Wake up, poker fans! We're down to our final two players in heads-up action for the Championship. Your perspective, Teller?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: All in.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: But-but, you didn't even look at your cards!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Looking at one's cards is a crutch for players who rely on skill.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Any day now, Fry. You in or out?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: What's the matter, Fry, you scared? Or just crazy?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: All right, all in. Yes! Four aces!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Ah-ah-ah. Read 'em and weep, and then tell me what they are.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Two kings. And with three on the board, that gives Bender five kings.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: But how is that...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: I don't believe it. Bender has just been dealt the King of Beers, a coaster from the bar that somehow got mixed into the deck. But it still counts!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Bender win the Championship!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: That's some good money.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: You did it, Bender. You're the greatest.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Tell me something I don't know, sweetass. Now, let's boogie. We'll be in Space Tahiti before the Donbot knows what hit him.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Now I am suspicious.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 1
Line: Okay, we finished digging this shallow grave. Can we go now?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Previously, on Futurama.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: You need one of these doodangs.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: A foil hat?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Truth is, you're a mind reader.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Oh, my God!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: You're having an affair with the head of the robot mafia's wife?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Okay, we finished digging this shallow grave.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Poor Bender left me one last voicemail before the Robot Mafia buried him in the desert.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Fry, old friend, before I die, I just wanted to say... Hang on, I'm getting another call. Hello?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Line up, people! Everyone take a shovel and one sixth of the planet. We'll meet back here in 50 years, our bodies broken and our lives wasted.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: And you say these are free shovels?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I'm back, baby.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Bender! I thought the Robot Mafia killed you.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Nah, they just shot us and buried us a few times as a warning.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Bender was so brave. He never stopped making out with me the whole time they were shooting us.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I sure didn't.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I gotta get back to my husband, baby. Will I see you tonight?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Probably not.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It's a 14-footer with a clown hazard. What club you recommend, Baggy?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: As on every hole, I suggest the putter.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Your golf club sure is classy, Mr. Wong. Naked statue classy.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It is very nice. I just wish Amy and I didn't have to wear these sexist badges on our melons.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: We're lucky even to play as guests, Leela. Dad's club has a very strict "No girls allowed" policy.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: That doesn't seem fair.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It really is. Everybody knows women don't have the focus to play miniature golf at a professional level.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: But that's the best shot of the day!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Is that my ball? I think that my ball.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Pfft, great putt, Dad.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Okay, we're done.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Mr. Wong, how do you keep this place so green in the middle of the desert? Doesn't that waste a lot of water?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Nah, we got plenty water, pumped directly from flamingo lake. They'll be fine.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Oh, yeah, I love miniature golf. Love everything about it, except how damn miniature it is. That's why I'm building the universe's biggest miniature golf course.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: This the first tee.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Where's the hole?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: On Pluto's moon, Hydra. It's a six-billion-mile par-two. Tough shot, even for a man. (Leo VO)  Around the sun. Bank off Jupiter. And right into the... I'll be right back. It dropped in! Put me down for a two.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Two.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Keep in mind, that just the first hole. For full course, we gonna bulldoze this entire arm of the Milky Way.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: What? You're gonna wipe out 10% of the galaxy for a stupid golf course?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: First of all, it 12% . Second, yes, you betcha.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: But you have no idea what life forms might be evolving out there.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: That's exactly why I'm hiring an impartial scientist to perform an environmental survey. That's him in the money shower.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Delivery boy's log. Having fallen asleep on what I thought was the toilet, I awoke to find the environmental survey in progress.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Status reports, Science Officer.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Zilcho. No sign of life or intelligence. (Telepathically)  Just like Fry on a date.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hey!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Okay, so we haven't found any life yet. I still don't see why you men can't be happy with regular-sized miniature golf.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Leela, evolution has programmed our fabulous male brains to take anything anybody else thinks is important and make it bigger. Have you seen my new 301-inch TV?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hypnotoad is brought to you by the MagnaPhallix 302-inch TV. It's bigger!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Oh, hell!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Captain, I'm detecting life on the Spock-o-scope!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It's amazing. It's like a textbook on evolution.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Except in Kansas.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: But isn't Mr. Wong building the 18th hole here? And the golf pants museum?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Indeed so. This whole area will be incinerated when he implodes that sun there into a black hole.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: That beautiful violet star?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It's so you can't keep your ball at the end of the game.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Yo, that's messed up.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: There won't be any imploding once they read our environmental review. Right, Professor?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Ohh, twaddle-squat. There's no scientific consensus that life is important.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Yeah. Life, schmife.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Approved for demolition.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It's you and me, ponytail.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: We're here, Mr. President.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Arroo! Let's play some mini-golf.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Just give it a light tap, Agnew. No, no, no, just a light...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Now for a triple clam dip, with a double - OW! OW!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Tough luck, Agnew. Looks like you and Wong owe me a Charleston Chew.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Shut up and hear our wisdom. Save the ecosystem. Shut up and hear our wisdom!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: What gives, Wong? You said no chicks allowed.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: We are the Greenorita Eco-Feminist Collective, and we will not let you...What was it again?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: We will not let you implode the violet dwarf star at galactic coordinates 167.84, -58.03, mark 948.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Already approved, you cackling hens. So get out, or I'll have vice-president Agnew's headless body throw you out.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I'd like to see him try.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Me, too. Should look funny. Sic 'em, Agnew.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Runaway golf cart!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Look out, Agnew!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Whoa!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Aah!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Is... is he okay?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: No pulse.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: They killed the headless remains of Agnew. Arrest them!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: All Feministas she-vacuate the premises. I mean "femises."

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: My fellow Earthicans, these eco-crooks will face the maximum sentence. For killing a headless torso, that's six weeks.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Well, this is embarrassing. Here I've been blabbing on for years about killing all humans, and who actually does something about it? Some chick.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Leela's not a killer, and she's not some chick. She's the chick I love. And don't tell her I called her a chick, or she'll kill me.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Everyone stay absolutely quiet!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: That thing's on. Shh!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Turn it off!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Oh, sorry.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: How do you turn it off?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: There. Did that do it?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: No. Stop it. Shut up.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Here's the button here. (Through megaphone)  And I think I... Now I got it.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Let me give you a hand.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: This is awful. I never meant for our protest to have any effect.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Maybe we should just surrender and serve our six weeks in jail.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hey, yeah! We could do each other's toenails and make shivs.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: That's crazy. We've done nothing wrong, other than killing and dismembering the vice-president. We need to make a choice, sisters. We can either keep pestering criminals like Leo Wong with silly slogans...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Yeah. Let's do that.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Actually, I meant that to be the less preferable alternative. We can either chant slogans or we can take action.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: What was the first choice again?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I choose to save the environment by sabotaging Leo Wong's golf course. Who's with me?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Could we still use our bullhorns?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Absolutely. Bullhorns are a core principle of eco-feminism.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Then I'm in.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Who's ready to kick some sweaty man-butt?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I've got my pointy man-kicking shoes on.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Those are cute.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Aren't they? I got them at Nine West.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Simmer down, warriors. Full power to the vagyroscope!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Those dirty rings. I tried soaking them out, even blasting them out.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Are you sure about this? It would be better for propaganda if we weren't using refined sugar.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It's okay. The potato we're shoving in the tailpipe is organic.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I smell sabotage. Ooh, and potatoes.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Now, unfortunately, the media is going to put a negative spin on this, like when we killed that guy, so to win public support, we'll need a lovable mascot.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Squirm all you want, you nasty dumpling. One less species for the universe, one more breakfast for...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Zoidberg?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Leela. Me saving things the leech. Not the eating of it.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Zoidberg, I'm very surprised at you, slightly.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Psst! Leela.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Shh! I'm a fugitive.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I know. I miss you so much, Leela, even more than when you were here.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I miss you, too, Fry. And you probably think what I'm doing is wrong. But it's something I really care about...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: You don't have to explain, Leela. You're you. That's all I need to know.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Goodbye, sweet goofbag.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I'll miss her, too, buddy. Dibs on her iPod.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Dibs on her- ohh...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hey, Fry! Long time, man.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hey, Hutch! What have you been up to?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Same old, same old. Searching the dumpsters, protecting my thoughts with tin foil, peeing myself.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: So, what brings you to Earth?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It's top secret. Hey, take off your helmet and I'll think it to you.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Okay. Here goes.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Where are you? And me?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: The Great Hall of the Ancient Legion of Madfellows. Welcome, bro.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Welcome, bro.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Sorry I bashed your head in, buddy, but I had to. You see, the fate of the universe depends on you.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Yeah, I get that a lot.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: The Grand Curator will tell you more.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Take me to him.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hey, man.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hey.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: So dig this, Fry. Our commune has been monitoring the universe's life energy for, like, a really long time, and we're grokking some super weird junk.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Um, I don't mean to be rude, but it's kind of hard to take you seriously when you say junk like "grok" and "junk."

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: What about "commune"?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Especially "commune." Come on, it's the fate of the universe, puff it up a little. Like you could say your ancient order is sensing deep upheaval in the cosmic life energy field.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Okay. I'll try. So, like, a really, really long time ago... Eons ago! Cool. Eons ago, the life force we call Chee permeated the universe. The Green Chee generated a great upwelling of life across the cosmos. But then, for reasons unknown...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Ooh. "Reasons unknown." Now that's the sort of hook that grabs the attention of me, the viewer.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: For reasons unknown...

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Nice.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: ...the Chee began to recede, and the diversity of life began to wither. The life forms we know today are but a fraction of a fraction of the magnificence that once existed.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: But a bunch of dudes, right, they totally passed this far-out knowledge down through the ages.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Some with this knowledge were called prophets, some, fruitcakes. We, the Legion of Madfellows, are their heirs.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hey, I'm on TV.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Well, that's the show.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Neat. What's it got to do with me?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Ahh, pooperdoodle! I mean, pardon the omission. You see, after untold eternities, we have sensed a resurgence in the Chee.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hey, that's the violet dwarf star that Leela wants to save.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Freaking nailed it, corndog.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: We believe this star heralds a new green age, and it's your destiny to be its shepherd and protector.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Me? Why?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: 'Cause you got, like, no delta brainwave, man. The Dark Ones can't groove off your thoughts.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Silence, Hutch! For now, let's just say we have enemies, enemies who can read minds, except yours.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Cool. I can't wait to tell Leela.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: No! If you tell anyone, then their thoughts could be read. For the sake of those you love, you must keep this secret. Do you foot-swear?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Oh, okay. I foot-swear.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Good. Now, to save the coming of the green age, you must stop this man.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I know him. Leo Wong. I work with his daughter.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Oh, good, that will cut about 15 minutes of explanation. You must gain Wong's confidence, infiltrate his organization and prevent him from destroying the violet dwarf.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Looking for a job, eh?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Yes, sir. Nothing fancy. I'm willing to start at the bottom and infiltrate my way up.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Sorry, no openings right now. (Telepathically)  What I need is security guard to keep nutcases out of my office.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I'm good at keeping nutcases.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I said no way. (Telepathically)  This idiot don't look like he could handle those feministas.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I look like an idiot who can handle those feministas.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: He'll have to do better than that.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I'll have to do better than that.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Hmm. You and I think a lot alike. You really think you can stand up to those eco-freakos?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Sir, with me around, they'll be the least of your worries.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Stand by, men. And manly aliens. Prepare to test fire King Kong hole.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: It workses.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Good job, men. And manly aliens. Construction of King Kong hole complete.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Typical. Always King Kong, never Queen... Quong.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: What are those, hooks? Get out of heres, you hookers.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Helpses!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: You go, gorilla !

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Our top story. The string of eco-vandalism that began with a harmless vice-presidential killing has spread across the galaxy.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Why do you always get to read the top story, Morbo?

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Because viewers trust a deep male voice and huge, throbbing forehead veins.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Not all reaction to the crime spree has been negative. We spoke with several people who viewed these courageous eco-feminists as heroes.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: I just wish there was some way to... Excuse me. Some way to show I support 'em. Send them some smokes or something.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: This just in  Root 2 News has received a video communique from the eco-feminists' unknown hideout.

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: This is sub-commander L., with a message for Leo Wong. Leo, you're a parasite on the universe, and parasites must be destroyed. That's why we've adopted this parasite as our mascot. I know it's a little confusing. The point is, even this vicious leech has a right to exist. And that's why a vicious leech like Leo Wong must be exterminated. Again, confusing. Feministas unite!

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: In other news-

Episode: Into the Wild Green Yonder Part 2
Line: Feministas unite!
